Hīkoi to Parliament live updates: Thousands descend on Wellington in historic day of mass protest https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hikoi-to-parliament-live-updates-thousands-descend-on-wellington-in-historic-day-of-mass-protest/HGI2Z5XVYBCXVHNDGPSFGWPFBQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hikoi-to-parliament-live-updates-thousands-descend-on-wellington-in-historic-day-of-mass-protest/HGI2Z5XVYBCXVHNDGPSFGWPFBQ/ The hīkoi is expected to arrive at Parliament around midday. Mon, 18 Nov 2024 18:16:00 +0000 Marchers are heading down Featherston St past the train station. Up to 30,000 people are expected to join the Hīkoi mō te Tiriti marching on Parliament this morning in opposition to Act’s Treaty Principles Bill. Photo / Melissa Nightingale

The New Zealand town with the most business break-ins https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/companies/retail/the-new-zealand-town-with-the-most-business-break-ins/2RYTR3C5IZDJJMLQXDTSBBDCWM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/companies/retail/the-new-zealand-town-with-the-most-business-break-ins/2RYTR3C5IZDJJMLQXDTSBBDCWM/ Tom RaynelThe data show Rotorua has the highest proportion of burglaries in New Zealand. Mon, 18 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Rotorua is New Zealand's business break-in capital, with a whopping 40.3 break-ins per 10,000 residents. Elsewhere, Porirua is New Zealand's safest, with just 6.1 break-ins per 10,000. Photo / Andrew Warner
